title: Do Britishers hate Mahatma Gandhi? - Quora

response.answer_text: A big NO! Come on, they now have the statue of Mahatma Gandhi placed in Parliament Square, Westminster. Would they ever do that if they hated him? Can you imagine a statue of Ho Chi Minh in Washington Square? Or say, a statue of Dalai Lama in Tiananmen Square, Beijing? For all their flaws, the British are not foolish enough to hate the messenger of peace and non-violence. However, there was one particular British Prime Minister who was quite vocal in his hatred for Gandhi.  Interestingly, Gandhi loved the British as well. In fact, his closest friend was the English priest, C.F. Andrews, who was one of the very few people to address him by his first name, Mohan.  Gandhi with the mill workers in Lancashire.
